subject: Philosophy
title: Creating Your Own Meaning
description: A quick, practical guide to Creating Your Own Meaning.

hook.text: If the universe doesn't hand you a purpose, can you build one yourself?

buildup.text: Sartre said yes. Existence precedes essence â€” you exist first, then define yourself.

discovery.text: Through choices, relationships, and projects, you write your own meaning into the world.

twist.text: But this freedom is terrifying. With no script, every choice carries total responsibility.

climax.text: Meaning isn't waiting to be found. It's something you build, one decision at a time.

punchline.text: You're the author. The page is blank.

quiz.question: What did Sartre mean by 'existence precedes essence'?
options: We exist first, then define who we are
The soul exists before the body
Meaning is built into the universe
